articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: It is a "decisive moment" in the Gaza ceasefire talks, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Monday, describing the latest diplomatic push by Washington to strike a deal between Israel and Hamas to end the war as "probably the best, maybe the last opportunity" to also get the hostages home.
articles.title: Blinken says 'decisive moment' for Gaza ceasefire talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's Coast Guard said a Philippine vessel that had ignored its repeated warnings "deliberately collided" with a Chinese vessel in an "unprofessional and dangerous" manner in the disputed South China Sea, according to statements on Monday.
articles.title: China says Philippine vessel 'deliberately collided' with Chinese vessel in the South China Sea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines has detected a new case of the mpox virus in the country, the first since December last year, its health department said on Monday.
articles.title: Philippines detects new mpox case, first since December 2023

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Washington Post said Ukraine and Russia were set to send delegations to Qatar to negotiate a landmark agreement halting strikes on energy and power infrastructure.
articles.title: Russia denies report about indirect talks with Ukraine

articles.author: Subrata Nag Choudhury
articles.description: Thousands of Indian junior doctors on Monday refused to end protests over the rape and murder of a fellow medic, disrupting hospital services nearly a week since they launched a nation-wide action demanding safer workplace and swift criminal action.
articles.title: Indian medics refuse to end protests over doctor's rape and murder

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's President Xi Jinping held talks on Monday with Vietnam's new leader To Lam in Beijing on his first state visit since he took office, Chinese official media Xinhua said.
articles.title: China and Vietnam's top leaders meet in Beijing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea and the United States kicked off annual summertime military exercises on Monday, seeking to boost their joint readiness to fend off North Korea's weapons and cyber threats.
articles.title: South Korea, US kick off annual drills over North's military, cyber threats

articles.author: Steve Holland, Doina Chiacu, Nandita Bose
articles.description: Democrats gathered in Chicago on Monday to celebrate Vice President Kamala Harris' campaign for the White House against Republican Donald Trump and to honor President Joe Biden, whose exit from the race turned his party's fortunes around.
articles.title: Democrats, protesters gather in Chicago to cheer, challenge Harris and Biden

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel is conducting a "robust investigation" of suspects accused of sexually abusing a Palestinian prisoner and is committed to upholding international legal standards regarding the treatment of detainees, the foreign affairs ministry said on Sunday.
articles.title: Israel says investigation underway in Palestinian prisoner abuse case

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Group organizers declined to give details, but said they would offer amendments to the party platform and use their rights as delegates to speak on the convention floor.
articles.title: Pro-Palestinian DNC convention delegates seek Israel arms embargo
